# Runtimes

Syncular is designed for **universal TypeScript apps**. This section helps you pick the right database dialect and understand runtime-specific setup and constraints.

> Start here if you’re unsure which dialect to use. If you already chose a runtime, follow [Client Setup](/docs/build/client-setup) and then come back for runtime caveats.

## Quick recommendations

- **Web:** `@syncular/dialect-wa-sqlite` (default) or `@syncular/dialect-pglite`
- **Electron:** `@syncular/dialect-electron-sqlite` (renderer → main IPC) or `@syncular/dialect-better-sqlite3`
- **Expo / React Native:** `@syncular/dialect-expo-sqlite` or `@syncular/dialect-react-native-nitro-sqlite`
- **Bun / Node:** `@syncular/dialect-bun-sqlite`, `@syncular/dialect-better-sqlite3`, or `@syncular/dialect-sqlite3`
- **Cloudflare:** run the server with `@syncular/server-cloudflare` and pair it with a dialect (D1/SQLite or Neon/Postgres)
